reviews.review_msg: The course material presented about international business was not only relevant but it also enabled me to leverage that info at work. Great presentation tips. Very helpful and understanding when issues were raised. Would recommend taking this course with him. Reading the course outline and group project outline thoroughly are key to doing well.
Young teacher. Tries hard. Marking schemes don't make a lot of sense.

Practical teacher. Easy marker. Engaging. Friendly and personable. Funny. Does not require you to buy a text. Responds very quickly to e-mails. Takes suggestions into consideration. Just be sure to clarify exactly what you need to do for any assignments or projects. Overall, good prof, I would recommend taking this course with him.

Phil challenges his students by using a "test how you think" not "test what you know" mindset. No textbook regurgitation, but rather an analysis of one Harvard case study each week make lecture engaging and interest. Midterms and finals are the same - no textbook memorization but critical thinking analyzing cases. Phil shares his passion each class

Great prof, very enthusiastic about course material which makes it easy to pay attention during lecture. Desires for all his students to succeed and will go to bat for them! Challenges you to think, but not beyond what you can handle. Overall, great course!

Great professor, she is young so very relatable to students. The exams are very fair and nothing out of the blue, just go over the textbook. Go to her for help with the group project, not going was a mistake our group made. Overall great class and you learn a lot about how businesses are conducted in nations other than Canada.

Emily is the best prof I've had at SFU. Her lectures are very engaging and she is clearly passionate about marketing. Maybe it's because the class was only 40 people, but she made the effort to learn everyone's name and was friendly with all of us, which made it feel more like a peer-to-peer relationship, rather than teacher-to-student.

Hands down my favourite prof at SFU so far. Emily is very enthusiastic and passionate about what she teaches, and she is very understanding of all points of view. She is a fair marker because she takes individual logical explanations into consideration as she marks. Most of all, she is like a peer and is always willing to help with questions!
